div.p: The Publisher field is available in the Bibliography Database to record the publisher's name as per MLA practice.

The Orlando Project follows MLA practice with a few exceptions. For example, do not use the abbreviation UP; instead, write out the words University Press. Other MLA rules apply: omit business abbreviations (Co., Corp., Inc.) and descriptive words (Books, House, Press, Publishers).

We normally give the shortest version of the publisher's name that still maintains clarity. For example, Gollancz rather than Victor Gollancz; J. Johnson rather than Joseph Johnson or Johnson; Macmillan rather than Macmillan and Co. BUT check authority list or whatever list of standard OrgNames Orlando uses in the future.

Do not replicate ampersands in publishers' names and do not use ampersands in the Bibliography Database. Ampersands have their own meaning in SGML; as a result they will wreak havoc within text marked up in SGML. Expand to and.
Use the abbreviation n.p. if the publisher's name is not available.
